alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:22PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Converse County through 745 PM MDT... At 722 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Glenrock, or 14 miles southeast of Casper, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Converse County. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 166 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
